description.narrative: Output 2.3: Law enforcement officials have an increased capacity to identify, prevent and report violence against children and child marriage., which contributes to Access To Justice, Access To Justice (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Evaluation And Research, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2:By the end of 2023, adolescents (10 to 19 years), particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from gender-responsive quality health, HIV, learning and protection services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.3: Law enforcement officials have an increased capacity to identify, prevent and report violence against children and child marriage.

description.narrative: Due to several internal HR changes in UNICEF LCO's child protection section, little progress was made in the first months of 2020. However, upon the outbreak of COVID-19 pandemic, UNICEF supported the Ministry of Social Development to develop a COVID-19 CP response plan in April 2020 which focuses on sector coordination and provision of materials and training to social workers to ensure continuitation of child protection services at community level. Most of the activities will be implemented in the second half of the year. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
